intro: Lomelosia esfandiarii, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
